page.title: 11RECENT HISTORY.
page.content: Sir Hubert Parry. Knightcroft House, which backs onto Sea Lane, Rustington, was divided into four flats forty years ago, but it was once the home of a great English composer. A plaque in Sea Lane commemorates him in these words: Sir Hubert Parry Musician (1848-1918) lived here (1879-1918) {In this house he composed his setting {of Blake's poem, "Jerusalem." He is famous not only as a composer of music, especially choral works, but also as a writer about music. In our school assemblies we still sing the hymns "Jerusalem "and "Dear Lord and Father of Mankind "to tunes which he wrote.
